tools.description: Build, test, fuzz, debug and deploy Solidity contracts

options.name: color
options.description: The color of the log messages

options.name: threads
options.description: Number of threads to use. Specifying 0 defaults to the number of logical cores

flags.name: verbosity
flags.description: Verbosity level of the log messages.

tools.name: forge_test
tools.description: Run the project's tests

positionals.name: PATH
positionals.description: The contract file you want to test, it's a shortcut for --match-path

options.name: color
options.description: The color of the log messages

options.name: threads
options.description: Number of threads to use. Specifying 0 defaults to the number of logical cores

options.name: dump
options.description: Dumps all debugger steps to file

options.name: gas-snapshot-check
options.description: Check gas snapshots against previous runs

options.name: gas-snapshot-emit
options.description: Enable/disable recording of gas snapshot results

options.name: etherscan-api-key
options.description: The Etherscan (or equivalent) API key

options.name: etherscan-api-version
options.description: The Etherscan API version

options.name: fuzz-seed
options.description: Set seed used to generate randomness during your fuzz runs

options.name: fuzz-timeout
options.description: Timeout for each fuzz run in seconds

options.name: fuzz-input-file
options.description: File to rerun fuzz failures from

options.name: match-test
options.description: Only run test functions matching the specified regex pattern

options.name: no-match-test
options.description: Only run test functions that do not match the specified regex pattern

options.name: match-contract
options.description: Only run tests in contracts matching the specified regex pattern

options.name: no-match-contract
options.description: Only run tests in contracts that do not match the specified regex pattern

options.name: match-path
options.description: Only run tests in source files matching the specified glob pattern

options.name: no-match-path
options.description: Only run tests in source files that do not match the specified glob pattern

options.name: no-match-coverage
options.description: Only show coverage for files that do not match the specified regex pattern

options.name: fork-url
options.description: Fetch state over a remote endpoint instead of starting from an empty state

options.name: fork-block-number
options.description: Fetch state from a specific block number over a remote endpoint

options.name: fork-retries
options.description: Number of retries

options.name: fork-retry-backoff
options.description: Initial retry backoff on encountering errors

options.name: initial-balance
options.description: The initial balance of deployed test contracts

options.name: sender
options.description: The address which will be executing tests/scripts

options.name: create2-deployer
options.description: The CREATE2 deployer address to use, this will override the one in the config

options.name: compute-units-per-second
options.description: Sets the number of assumed available compute units per second for this provider

options.name: code-size-limit
options.description: EIP-170: Contract code size limit in bytes. Useful to increase this because of tests. By default, it is 0x6000 (~25kb)

options.name: chain
options.description: The chain name or EIP-155 chain ID

options.name: gas-price
options.description: The gas price

options.name: block-base-fee-per-gas
options.description: The base fee in a block

options.name: tx-origin
options.description: The transaction origin

options.name: block-coinbase
options.description: The coinbase of the block

options.name: block-timestamp
options.description: The timestamp of the block

options.name: block-number
options.description: The block number

options.name: block-difficulty
options.description: The block difficulty

options.name: block-prevrandao
options.description: The block prevrandao value. NOTE: Before merge this field was mix_hash

options.name: block-gas-limit
options.description: The block gas limit

options.name: memory-limit
options.description: The memory limit per EVM execution in bytes. If this limit is exceeded, a `MemoryLimitOOG` result is thrown

options.name: libraries
options.description: Set pre-linked libraries

options.name: ignored-error-codes
options.description: Ignore solc warnings by error code

options.name: use
options.description: Specify the solc version, or a path to a local solc, to build with

options.name: out
options.description: The path to the contract artifacts folder

options.name: revert-strings
options.description: Revert string configuration

options.name: build-info-path
options.description: Output path to directory that build info files will be written to

options.name: skip
options.description: Skip building files whose names contain the given filter

options.name: evm-version
options.description: The target EVM version

options.name: optimize
options.description: Activate the Solidity optimizer

options.name: optimizer-runs
options.description: The number of runs specifies roughly how often each opcode of the deployed code will be executed across the life-time of the contract. This means it is a trade-off parameter between code size (deploy cost) and code execution cost (cost after deployment). An `optimizer_runs` parameter of `1` will produce short but expensive code. In contrast, a larger `optimizer_runs` parameter will produce longer but more gas efficient code

options.name: extra-output
options.description: Extra output to include in the contract's artifact

options.name: extra-output-files
options.description: Extra output to write to separate files

options.name: root
options.description: The project's root path

options.name: contracts
options.description: The contracts source directory

options.name: remappings
options.description: The project's remappings

options.name: remappings-env
options.description: The project's remappings from the environment

options.name: cache-path
options.description: The path to the compiler cache

options.name: lib-paths
options.description: The path to the library folder

options.name: config-path
options.description: Path to the config file

options.name: watch
options.description: Watch the given files or directories for changes

options.name: watch-delay
options.description: File update debounce delay

flags.name: verbosity
flags.description: Verbosity level of the log messages.

flags.name: quiet
flags.description: Do not print log messages

flags.name: json
flags.description: Format log messages as JSON

flags.name: debug
flags.description: Run a single test in the debugger

flags.name: flamegraph
flags.description: Generate a flamegraph for a single test. Implies `--decode-internal`

flags.name: flamechart
flags.description: Generate a flamechart for a single test. Implies `--decode-internal`

flags.name: decode-internal
flags.description: Identify internal functions in traces

flags.name: gas-report
flags.description: Print a gas report

flags.name: allow-failure
flags.description: Exit with code 0 even if a test fails

flags.name: suppress-successful-traces
flags.description: Suppress successful test traces and show only traces for failures

flags.name: junit
flags.description: Output test results as JUnit XML report

flags.name: fail-fast
flags.description: Stop running tests after the first failure

flags.name: list
flags.description: List tests instead of running them

flags.name: show-progress
flags.description: Show test execution progress

flags.name: rerun
flags.description: Re-run recorded test failures from last run. If no failure recorded then regular test run is performed

flags.name: summary
flags.description: Print test summary table

flags.name: detailed
flags.description: Print detailed test summary table

flags.name: no-storage-caching
flags.description: Explicitly disables the use of RPC caching

flags.name: ffi
flags.description: Enable the FFI cheatcode

flags.name: always-use-create-2-factory
flags.description: Use the create 2 factory in all cases including tests and non-broadcasting scripts

flags.name: no-rpc-rate-limit
flags.description: Disables rate limiting for this node's provider

flags.name: disable-block-gas-limit
flags.description: Whether to disable the block gas limit checks

flags.name: isolate
flags.description: Whether to enable isolation of calls. In isolation mode all top-level calls are executed as a separate transaction in a separate EVM context, enabling more precise gas accounting and transaction state changes

flags.name: odyssey
flags.description: Whether to enable Odyssey features

flags.name: force
flags.description: Clear the cache and artifacts folder and recompile

flags.name: no-cache
flags.description: Disable the cache

flags.name: dynamic-test-linking
flags.description: Enable dynamic test linking

flags.name: deny-warnings
flags.description: Warnings will trigger a compiler error

flags.name: no-auto-detect
flags.description: Do not auto-detect the `solc` version

flags.name: offline
flags.description: Do not access the network

flags.name: via-ir
flags.description: Use the Yul intermediate representation compilation pipeline

flags.name: use-literal-content
flags.description: Changes compilation to only use literal content and not URLs

flags.name: no-metadata
flags.description: Do not append any metadata to the bytecode

flags.name: build-info
flags.description: Generate build info files

flags.name: ast
flags.description: Includes the AST as JSON in the compiler output

flags.name: hardhat
flags.description: Use the Hardhat-style project layout

flags.name: no-restart
flags.description: Do not restart the command while it's still running

flags.name: run-all
flags.description: Explicitly re-run all tests when a change is made

tools.name: forge_script
tools.description: Run a smart contract as a script, building transactions that can be sent onchain

positionals.name: PATH
positionals.description: The contract you want to run. Either the file path or contract name

positionals.name: ARGS
positionals.description: Arguments to pass to the script function

options.name: color
options.description: The color of the log messages

options.name: threads
options.description: Number of threads to use. Specifying 0 defaults to the number of logical cores

options.name: target-contract
options.description: The name of the contract you want to run

options.name: sig
options.description: The signature of the function you want to call in the contract, or raw calldata

options.name: priority-gas-price
options.description: Max priority fee per gas for EIP1559 transactions

options.description: Batch size of transactions

options.name: gas-estimate-multiplier

options.name: dump
options.description: Dumps all debugger steps to file

options.description: The Etherscan (or equivalent) API key

options.name: etherscan-api-version
options.description: The Etherscan API version

options.name: with-gas-price

options.name: timeout
options.description: Timeout to use for broadcasting transactions

options.name: libraries
options.description: Set pre-linked libraries

options.name: ignored-error-codes
options.description: Ignore solc warnings by error code

options.name: use
options.description: Specify the solc version, or a path to a local solc, to build with

options.name: out
options.description: The path to the contract artifacts folder

options.description: Revert string configuration

options.description: The number of runs specifies roughly how often each opcode of the deployed code will be executed across the life-time of the contract. This means it is a trade-off parameter between code size (deploy cost) and code execution cost (cost after deployment). An `optimizer_runs` parameter of `1` will produce short but expensive code. In contrast, a larger `optimizer_runs` parameter will produce longer but more gas efficient code

options.name: color
options.description: The color of the log messages

options.description: Number of threads to use. Specifying 0 defaults to the number of logical cores

options.name: port
options.description: Port number to listen on

options.description: Number of dev accounts to generate and configure

options.description: The balance of every dev account in Ether

options.name: timestamp
options.description: The timestamp of the genesis block

options.name: number
options.description: The number of the genesis block

options.name: mnemonic
options.description: BIP39 mnemonic phrase used for generating accounts. Cannot be used if `mnemonic_random` or `mnemonic_seed` are used

options.name: mnemonic-random
options.description: Automatically generates a BIP39 mnemonic phrase, and derives accounts from it. Cannot be used with other `mnemonic` options. You can specify the number of words you want in the mnemonic. [default: 12]

options.name: mnemonic-seed-unsafe
options.description: Generates a BIP39 mnemonic phrase from a given seed Cannot be used with other `mnemonic` options

options.name: derivation-path
options.description: Sets the derivation path of the child key to be derived

options.name: hardfork
options.description: The EVM hardfork to use

options.name: block-time
options.description: Block time in seconds for interval mining

options.description: Slots in an epoch

options.description: Writes output of `anvil` as json to user-specified file

options.description: The hosts the server will listen on

options.description: How transactions are sorted in the mempool

options.description: Initialize the genesis block with the given `genesis.json` file

options.description: Dump the state and block environment of chain on exit to the given file

options.description: Initialize the chain from a previously saved state snapshot

options.description: Timeout in ms for requests sent to remote JSON-RPC server in forking mode

options.name: retries
options.description: Number of retry requests for spurious networks (timed out requests)

options.description: Fetch state from a specific block number over a remote endpoint

options.description: Initial retry backoff on encountering errors

options.description: Sets the number of assumed available compute units per second for this provider

options.name: gas-limit

options.description: EIP-170: Contract code size limit in bytes. Useful to increase this because of tests. To disable entirely, use `--disable-code-size-limit`. By default, it is 0x6000 (~25kb)

options.description: The memory limit per EVM execution in bytes

options.description: The number of runs specifies roughly how often each opcode of the deployed code will be executed across the life-time of the contract.
